unnormalised: Chai time discussions across India are heating up – and not just because of the garam masala! Gas cylinder prices are once again the talk of the town, just ahead of Diwali.
normalised: Chai time discussions across India are heating up – and not just because of the garam masala! Gas cylinder prices are once again the talk of the town, just ahead of Diwali.

unnormalised: Households are feeling the pinch, with unsubsidized 14.2 kg cylinders costing around Rs. 1150 in Mumbai and slightly less in smaller towns like Kanpur. That's a sizeable dent in the Diwali budget, especially with all that festive cooking to be done.
normalised: Households are feeling the pinch, with unsubsidized fourteen point two kilogram cylinders costing around rupee one thousand one hundred and fifty in Mumbai and slightly less in smaller towns like Kanpur. That's a sizeable dent in the Diwali budget, especially with all that festive cooking to be done.

unnormalised: "How will we make those amazing gulab jamuns for Diwali with such expensive gas?" lamented Lakshmi Amma from Chennai.
normalised: "How will we make those amazing gulab jamuns for Diwali with such expensive gas?" lamented Lakshmi Amma from Chennai.

unnormalised: Industry experts at IIM Ahmedabad are attributing the price hike to global crude oil fluctuations and increased demand.
normalised: Industry experts at I I M Ahmedabad are attributing the price hike to global crude oil fluctuations and increased demand.

unnormalised: "It's a bit much, no?" said Rajesh, a Delhi resident, "Especially when you're also buying diyas and sweets. Maybe we'll have to cut back on the biryani this Diwali!"
normalised: "It's a bit much, no?" said Rajesh, a Delhi resident, "Especially when you're also buying diyas and sweets. Maybe we'll have to cut back on the biryani this Diwali!"

unnormalised: The government is reportedly considering options to ease the burden, possibly through revised subsidy schemes. Let's hope they announce something soon, so everyone can enjoy a bright and delicious Diwali without breaking the bank. Perhaps a gas price cut before Lakshmi Puja? Only time will tell!
normalised: The government is reportedly considering options to ease the burden, possibly through revised subsidy schemes. Let's hope they announce something soon, so everyone can enjoy a bright and delicious Diwali without breaking the bank. Perhaps a gas price cut before Lakshmi Puja? Only time will tell!
